etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in The Atlantic Monthly. From Spanish dátil date, so called on account of the fruit or seed pods of these plants resembling dates

definitions: A white-flowered yucca, Yucca baccata, native to deserts in the southwestern United States and northern Mexico.

More fully "datil pepper". A very spicy variety of chilli pepper, Capsicum chinense, chiefly cultivated in the southern United States and used especially in the Spanish-influenced cuisine of parts of Florida.
